Join SVG plots. This function first populates each place in the first column, then rows in the seccond column

join_plots.Rd

Join SVG plots. This function first populates each place in the first column, then rows in the seccond column

join_plots(..., nrows = length(list(...)), ncols = 1)

Arguments

...

mumltiple character vectors with SVG content
nrows

number of rows of plots in joint plot, default is set to number of plots
ncols

number of columns of plots in joint plot, default is set to 1

Value

Character vector with SVG content

Examples

  df <- data.frame(
   mon = month.abb[1:6],
   values = rnorm(6)
  )

join_plots(
  column_chart(df, x = 'mon', series = 'values'),
  column_chart(df, x = 'mon', series = 'values')
) %>% SVGrenderer()
